# Load the CSV file into a DataFrame using pandas
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

    # Group the DataFrame by the specified column name
    grouped = df.groupby(col1_name)

    # Calculate the mean for each group for the specified column name
    mean_vals = grouped[col2_name].mean()

    # Create a bar plot using matplotlib
    ax = mean_vals.plot(kind='bar')

    # Set the plot title
    ax.set_title(f"Mean of {col2_name} Grouped by {col1_name}")

    # Set the x-axis label
    ax.set_xlabel(col1_name)

    # Set the y-axis label
    ax.set_ylabel(f"Mean of {col2_name}")

    # Return the Axes object of the bar plot
    return ax

# Read the CSV file using the provided file path
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

    # Group the DataFrame by the specified column 'col1_name'
    # and calculate the mean for each group in the column 'col2_name'
    grouped_mean = df.groupby(col1_name)[col2_name].mean()

    # Create the bar plot using matplotlib
    ax = grouped_mean.plot(kind="bar")

    # Set the plot title
    ax.set_title(f"Mean of {col2_name} Grouped by {col1_name}")

    # Set the labels for the x and y-axes
    ax.set_xlabel(col1_name)

# Read data from CSV file using pandas
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

    # Perform groupby and calculate mean

# Load the CSV file into a DataFrame
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

    # Group the DataFrame by the specified column
    grouped = df.groupby(col1_name)

    # Calculate the mean for each group on the specified column
    means = grouped[col2_name].mean()

    # Create a figure and an Axes object for the plot
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()

    # Generate the bar plot
    ax.bar(means.index, means.values)

    # Configure the plot title
    ax.set_title(f"Mean of {col2_name} Grouped by {col1_name}")

    # Set the x-axis label
    ax.set_xlabel(col1_name)

    # Set the y-axis label
    ax.set_ylabel(f"Mean of {col2_name}")

    # Return the Axes object of the generated bar plot
    return ax

# Read CSV data into a DataFrame
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

    # Group data by column1, calculate mean for column2, and reset index
    mean_values = df.groupby(col1_name)[col2_name].mean().reset_index()

    # Create a bar plot using matplotlib
    ax = plt.bar(mean_values[col1_name], mean_values[col2_name])

    # Set plot title and axis labels
    plt.title(f"Mean of {col2_name} Grouped by {col1_name}")
    plt.xlabel(col1_name)
    plt.ylabel(f"Mean of {col2_name}")

    return ax

df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

    ax = grouped_mean.plot(kind="bar")
    ax.set_title(f"Mean of {col2_name} Grouped by {col1_name}")
    ax.set_xlabel(col1_name)
    ax.set_ylabel(f"Mean of {col2_name}")
    plt.tight_layout()

    return ax

df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)

    df_mean = df.groupby(col1_name)[col2_name].mean()
    df_mean = df_mean.reset_index()

    plt.style.use("ggplot")

    ax = plt.bar(df_mean[col1_name], df_mean[col2_name])
    plt.title("Mean of " + col2_name + " Grouped by " + col1_name)
    plt.xlabel(col1_name)
    plt.ylabel("Mean of " + col2_name)

    return ax

# Read CSV file with no index column
    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path, index_col=None)

    # Group data by 'col1_name' and calculate mean for 'col2_name'
    grouped_mean = df.groupby([col1_name])[col2_name].mean()

    # Create bar plot with matplotlib
    ax = grouped_mean.plot(kind="bar")

    # Set plot title and axis labels
    ax.set_title("Mean of " + col2_name + " Grouped by " + col1_name)
    ax.set_xlabel(col1_name)
    ax.set_ylabel("Mean of " + col2_name)

    # Display plot if necessary

    # Return the Axes object for further customization
    return ax
